meanings.definition: To ask questions of (a person), sometimes to seek answers or information that the person questioned considers personal or secret.
meanings.sent1: The detective was interrogating the suspect in the small room.
meanings.sent2: The police officer was interrogating the witness to gather more details about the crime.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started interrogating the cat about its secret hiding spot for treats.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was interrogating the politician, trying to uncover hidden truths.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was interrogating the students to check their understanding of the lesson.

meanings.definition: To examine by questioning formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The committee was interrogating the candidate about their qualifications for the job.
meanings.sent2: The auditor was interrogating the financial records to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The robot started interrogating the malfunctioning machine to identify the issue.
meanings.sent4: The scientist was interrogating the data to find patterns and trends.
meanings.sent5: The inspector was interrogating the evidence to solve the case.
